page.title: 20SPA WATERS
page.content: From the 17th century onwards this area is recorded under the name of Cwn_y_Gof or Blacksmith's Dingle who was cured of an eye disease in the well there. In about 1867 a Saline Spring was discovered there and a pump erected nearby. The land was laid out as gardens and was planted with trees. In about 1880 it was named Rock Spa. Three other springs were discovered called Magnesia, Chalybeate and Sulphur. The eye well is said to cure eye disease whilst the Chalybeate was recommended for anaemia and general debility. After a decline in the use of Spa Waters there is now a sharp increase in their popularity and sales are increasing.
